intro: Andira legalis, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its rapid growth and invasive tendencies, it is sometimes considered a weed in certain regions.
